summary: Project now includes replacing existing Documents/Players' Documents with Members' Channels, plus per-player document privacy controls; also needs investigation of an initialization hang after login.
architectural_notes: Define access rules for private player documents: when Private, only owner (and possibly client) can view/edit; when not private, all members can view/edit like shared docs.
Clarify whether 'Members' Channels' is a renamed/parallel entity to existing Channels and how it replaces Documents/Players' Documents in navigation and data model.
known_issues: App remains stuck on 'Initializing' after login (user reports it still initializing).

existing_features.title: Remove the host-owned "Documents" feature from the app UI, including sidebar section, creation/rename/delete/lock controls, and the document editor view, so session navigation no longer offers host documents.
Add a new session feature called "Members' Channels" that behaves like the existing chat channels feature (list + selectable to open chat), but is distinct from the host-managed "Channels" list.

Define and enforce permissions for Members' Channels: any session member can create a Members' Channel; the channel creator can rename/delete their own Members' Channels; the session host can rename/delete any Members' Channel.

Remove the "Players' Documents" section from the sidebar and replace it with "Members' Channels" navigation, while preserving the requested per-player-document privacy control behavior for any remaining player-document access paths in the app.

Fix the post-login app state where the UI remains stuck on the "Initializing..." screen by identifying and correcting the blocking condition(s) in frontend initialization and/or backend calls so authenticated users reliably reach the Lobby or Session UI.

new_feature_requests.summary: Remove Documents and Players' Documents and replace with 'Members' Channels' (same as Channels)
Add per-player document privacy toggle ('Hide from others'/'Private') to control member visibility/editing

Add a simple privacy toggle control labeled "Private" (or "Hide from others") on each player document (where player documents are created/managed/edited) and ensure it updates the player document privacy state.

Enforce player document privacy on the backend: when a player document is private, only its owner (and optionally the host if you choose that policy) can list, fetch, or edit it; other session members must not see it in lists or be able to open it.

projectName: Replace Documents with Members' Channels and enforce Player Document privacy visibility
